title: Integrated Simulation-Based Lumbar Puncture Training Program

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Accessible to learners without prior medical simulation training, combining real-time video classes and virtual simulators using personal devices in a BYOD environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the step-by-step anatomical structures of a lumbar puncture procedure with at least 80% accuracy.
Learners can meet success criteria within three attempts when performing a lumbar puncture in an integrated simulation environment.
Learners achieve at least 75 points (out of 100) on a conceptual knowledge test one week after training.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
